Class CardUtils

  • java.lang.Object

extends java.lang.Object
    Provide information about different card types.

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        public static CardUtils.Cards getType(java.lang.String number)
        Returns a Cards object can be used to identify the card type and information about: regex, card/cvv maximum length, space separation The number argument must specify as a String.

        This method iterates a Cards enum, and determines if the the function argument matches any pattern. Based on the verification, a Cards object will be returned.

        Parameters:
        number - the String value of a card number
        Returns:
        Cards object for the given type found
        See Also:
        CardUtils.Cards

      • isValidCard

        public static boolean isValidCard(@Nullable
                                  java.lang.String number)
        Returns a boolean showing is the card String is a valid card number.

        This method is using the regex in CardUtils.Cards as well as the Luhn algorithm to the terms the validity of a card number

        Parameters:
        number - the String value of a card number
        Returns:
        If the card number is valid or not

      • getFormattedCardNumber

        public static java.lang.String getFormattedCardNumber(java.lang.String number)
        The card formatting method

        Used to take a card number String and provide formatting (span space characters)

        Parameters:
        number - card number in string format
        Returns:
        processedCard

      • isValidDate

        public static boolean isValidDate(java.lang.String month,
                                  java.lang.String year)
        Returns a boolean showing is the date is valid

        Used to take a card number String and provide formatting (span space characters)

        Parameters:
        month - the card expiration month as a string
        year - the card expiration year as a string
        Returns:
        boolean representing validity

      • isValidCvv

        public static boolean isValidCvv(java.lang.String cvv,
                                 CardUtils.Cards card)
        Returns a boolean showing is the cvv is valid in relation to the card type

        Used to take a card number String and provide formatting (span space characters)

        Parameters:
        cvv - the card cvv
        card - the card object
        Returns:
        boolean representing validity
